metadata.synopsis: Jack Lemmon directs his friend and frequent costar Walter Matthau in this gentle comedic drama. When retired salesman Joseph Kotcher (Walter Matthau) begins to feel pressure to move out of the house he shares with the family of his son, Gerald (Charles Aidman), he opts to embark on a road trip instead of settling in a retirement home. Befriending Erica (Deborah Winters), a young pregnant woman, Kotch begins to finds new meaning in life as he helps her prepare to welcome her baby into the world.

reviews: Matthau's warm characterization propels this sweet and earnest movie.
Though only 50 years old when he made the film, Matthau is more than convincing as the doddering Joe Kotcher...
Walter Matthau gives a compelling, Oscar-nominated performance as a grumpy old man in this melodrama, the only film star Jack Lemmon directed.
Great turn by Walter Matthau in aged makeup, and nicely directed by friend Jack Lemmon.
There aren't many comic actors I admire more than Matthau, and he does his best to be an old man in Kotch, but the illusion simply isn't there.
By all means, catch Kotch. It's a fine movie.
